article_metadata.description: BY AKASH CHOUGULE - The early troubles with Medicaid expansion are exactly what its opponents—on both sides of the aisle—have been warning all along: costs will greatly exceed budget projections and it will further burden a health care system that is already strained. A number of early expanders illustrate the magnitude of the problems that are putting both taxpayers and patients at risk.
article_metadata.author: Capital Flows

og.title: Learn From Other States' Experience: Don't Expand Medicaid
